chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
T: cpo
s: Pred T

Goal:
chain_closed (chain_closure s)

Premises:
chain_closed = [Pred s | bot \In s /\ (forall d : chain T, d <=p s -> lim d \In s)] : Simpl_Pred (Pred T)
Pred = fun T : Type => T -> Prop : Type -> Type Arguments Pred _%type_scope
chain_closure = fun s : Pred T => [Pred p | forall t : Pred T, s <=p t -> chain_closed t -> p \In t] : Pred T -> Simpl_Pred T
chain_clos_min : forall (s : Pred T) (t : Pred_Class), s <=p t -> chain_closed t -> chain_closure s <=p t
pairCPO = fun A B : cpo => CPO.Pack {| CPO.base := {| Poset.mixin := pairPosetMixin A B |}; CPO.mixin := pairCPOMixin A B |} (A * B) : cpo -> cpo -> cpo
CPO.poset = fun cT : cpo => Poset.Pack (CPO.class cT) cT : cpo -> poset CPO.poset is a coercion
CPO.sort = fun t : cpo => let (sort, _, _) := t in sort : cpo -> Type CPO.sort is a coercion
dfunCPO : forall A : Type, (A -> cpo) -> cpo
CPO.Pack : forall sort : Type, CPO.class_of sort -> Type -> cpo
propCPO = CPO.Pack {| CPO.base := Poset.class propPoset; CPO.mixin := propCPOMixin |} Prop : cpo
funCPO = fun (A : Type) (B : cpo) => CPO.Pack {| CPO.base := {| Poset.mixin := funPosetMixin A B |}; CPO.mixin := funCPOMixin A B |} (A -> B) : Type -> cpo -> cpo Arguments funCPO _%type_scope
CPO.clone : forall (T : Type) (cT : cpo) (c : CPO.class_of T), phant_id (CPO.class cT) c -> cpo
CPO.bot = fun cT : cpo => CPO.mx_bot (CPO.mixin (CPO.class cT)) : forall cT : cpo, cT Arguments CPO.bot {cT}
CPO.pack : forall (T : Type) (b0 : Poset.class_of T) (m0 m : CPO.mixin_of (Poset.Pack b0 T)), phant_id m0 m -> cpo
latCPO = fun A : lattice => CPO.Pack {| CPO.base := Lattice.class A; CPO.mixin := latCPOMixin A |} A : lattice -> cpo
CPO.lim = fun cT : cpo => [eta CPO.mx_lim (CPO.mixin (CPO.class cT))] : forall cT : cpo, chain cT -> cT Arguments CPO.lim {cT}
predCPO = fun A : Type => CPO.Pack {| CPO.base := {| Poset.mixin := funPosetMixin A propCPO |}; CPO.mixin := predCPOMixin A |} (Pred A) : Type -> cpo Arguments predCPO _%type_scope
sub_sup' : forall (T : lattice) (s : Pred T), Pred (subPoset s) -> T
Image' : forall A B : Type, Pred A -> (A -> B) -> Pred B
sub_sup : forall (T : lattice) (s : Pred T), sup_closed s -> Pred (subPoset s) -> subPoset s
PredD = fun (T : Type) (p1 p2 : Pred T) => [Pred x | xPredD p1 p2 x] : forall T : Type, Pred T -> Pred T -> Simpl_Pred T Arguments PredD {T}%type_scope
PredI = fun (T : Type) (p1 p2 : Pred T) => [Pred x | xPredI p1 p2 x] : forall T : Type, Pred T -> Pred T -> Simpl_Pred T Arguments PredI {T}%type_scope
PredU = fun (T : Type) (p1 p2 : Pred T) => [Pred x | xPredU p1 p2 x] : forall T : Type, Pred T -> Pred T -> Simpl_Pred T Arguments PredU {T}%type_scope
prop_sup = fun s : Pred Prop => exists p : Prop, p \In s /\ p : Pred Prop -> Prop
sub_supX : forall (T : lattice) (s : Pred T), sup_closed s -> forall u : Pred (subPoset s), sub_sup' u \In s
sup_closure = fun (T : lattice) (s : Pred T) => [Pred p | forall t : Pred T, s <=p t -> t \In sup_closed -> p \In t] : forall T : lattice, Pred T -> Simpl_Pred T Arguments sup_closure {T}
subPoset : forall T : poset, Pred T -> poset
chain_axiom : forall T : poset, Pred T -> Prop
inf : forall T : lattice, Pred T -> T
Pred_of_Simpl : forall T : Type, Simpl_Pred T -> Pred T
MemProp : forall T : Type, Pred T -> Mem_Pred T
chain_clos_sub : forall s : Pred T, s <=p chain_closure s
SimplPred : forall T : Type, Pred T -> Simpl_Pred T

```coq
intros.
unfold chain_closed.
split.
- apply bot_in_chain_closure.
  apply chain_clos_sub.
- intros d Hd.
  apply chain_clos_min with s.
  + apply Hd.
  + apply chain_clos_sub.
Qed.
```

original: intros. unfold chain_closed. split. - apply bot_in_chain_closure. apply chain_clos_sub. - intros d Hd. apply chain_clos_min with s. + apply Hd. + apply chain_clos_sub.
